title: The Sadness
review: Slowing down and lowering in intensity towards the end is a real sin in horror movies, unless they have something important to say. This slowed down and became a bit less interesting, and that's my biggest problem with it. It has a cool synth soundtrack. It is brutally violent, with mega-rabies spreading between humans in a coronavirus metaphor. I think it just makes the grade for a 10/10 grotesque rating.
